Property#

tosclib.property(key, value)[source]#

Property factory: Creates type-safe tuple.

Parameters

  • key (str) – Key of the property. Like “tag”, “outline”, “frame”, etc.

  • value (PropertyValue) – Any str, int, float, bool, tuple[float,…] or tuple[int,…] that fits the key.

Important

  • The Python type will dictate the “type” attribute for the XML Element.

  • A str will become type = “s”, bool will be “b”, etc.

  • The value arg becomes the Element’s text or sub elements depending on the value’s type.

  • tuple[int,…] converts to: {“x”:v[0], “y”:v[1], “w”:v[2], “h”:v[3]}

  • tuple[float,..] converts to the r,g,b,a equivalent.

Hint

  • This functions sirves mostly as a type-checker as you can create the tuple manually.

  • You can use the tosclib.properties module to find common properties and their types.

Examples

name = property("name", "GeoffPeterson")

<property type="s">
    <key>name</key>
    <value>GeoffPeterson</value>
</property>

frame = property("frame", (0,0,100,100))

<property type="r">
    <key>
        frame
    </key>
    <value>
        <x>0</x>
        <y>0</y>
        <w>100</w>
        <h>100</h>
    </value>
</property>
Returns

Property

Return type

Property

Value#

tosclib.value(key: Literal['touch'], locked, locked_dc, default: bool, pull)[source]#
tosclib.value(key: Literal['x', 'y'], locked, locked_dc, default: float, pull)
tosclib.value(key: Literal['page'], locked, locked_dc, default: int, pull)
tosclib.value(key: Literal['text'], locked, locked_dc, default: str, pull)
tosclib.value(key='touch', locked=False, locked_dc=False, default=True, pull=0)

Value Factory: Creates type-safe tuple.

Parameters

  • key (ValueKey, optional) – The key of the value. Default is “touch”.

  • locked (bool, optional) – Default is False.

  • locked_dc (bool, optional) – Lock default current. Default is False.

  • default (ValueDefault, optional) – This is the “value’s value”.

  • pull (int, optional) – Int from 0 to 100. Defaults to 0.

Important

  • Just as Property, this will convert the Python types into XML strings.

  • The default argument type must match the key:

    • For “touch” use a boolean.

    • For “page” use an int.

    • For “x”, “y” use a float.

    • For “text” use a str.

Examples

x = value(key = "x", default = 0.42)

<value>
    <key>x</key>
    <locked>0</locked>
    <lockedDefaultCurrent>0</lockedDefaultCurrent>
    <default>0.42</default>
    <defaultPull>0</defaultPull>
</value>

text = value(key = "text", default = "Synth")

<value>
    <key>text</key>
    <locked>0</locked>
    <lockedDefaultCurrent>0</lockedDefaultCurrent>
    <default>Synth</default>
    <defaultPull>0</defaultPull>
</value>
Returns

Value

Return type

Value

Message#

Attention

  • Messages are very complex so they are constructed with a few different parts.

  • There are a few different types of messages and they share some of those parts.

tosclib.osc(config=None, triggers=None, addrs=None, args=None)[source]#

OSC Message Factory: Creates type-safe new-type tuple.

Parameters

  • config (MsgConfig, optional) – Type-safe tuple. Defaults to None.

  • triggers (tuple[Trigger, ...], optional) – Tuple of type-safe tuples. Defaults to None.

  • addrs (tuple[Partial, ...], optional) – Tuple of type-safe tuples. Defaults to None.

  • args (tuple[Partial, ...], optional) – Tuple of type-safe tuples. Defaults to None.

Returns

_description_

Return type

MessageOSC

tosclib.midi(config=None, triggers=None, message=None, values=None)[source]#

MIDI Message Factory

Return type

NewType(MessageMIDI, tuple[Literal['midi'], NewType(MsgConfig, tuple[bool, bool, bool, bool, str]), tuple[NewType(Trigger, tuple[Literal['x', 'y', 'page', 'touch', 'text'], Literal['ANY', 'RISE', 'FALL']]), …], NewType(MidiMsg, tuple[Literal['NOTE_OFF', 'NOTE_ON', 'POLYPRESSURE', 'CONTROLCHANGE', 'PROGRAMCHANGE', 'CHANNELPRESSURE', 'PITCHBEND', 'SYSTEMEXCLUSIVE'], int, str, str]), tuple[NewType(MidiValue, tuple[Literal['CONSTANT', 'INDEX', 'VALUE', 'PROPERTY'], str, int, int]), …]])

tosclib.local(enabled=True, triggers=None, source=None, destination=None)[source]#

LOCAL Message factory

Return type

NewType(MessageLOCAL, tuple[Literal['local'], bool, tuple[NewType(Trigger, tuple[Literal['x', 'y', 'page', 'touch', 'text'], Literal['ANY', 'RISE', 'FALL']]), …], NewType(LocalSrc, tuple[Literal['CONSTANT', 'INDEX', 'VALUE', 'PROPERTY'], Literal['BOOLEAN', 'INTEGER', 'FLOAT', 'STRING'], str, int, int]), NewType(LocalDst, tuple[Literal['CONSTANT', 'INDEX', 'VALUE', 'PROPERTY'], str, str])])

Message Parts#

tosclib.msgconfig(enabled=True, send=True, receive=True, feedback=False, connection='11111')[source]#

Message config factory.

Parameters

  • enabled (bool, optional) – _description_. Defaults to True.

  • send (bool, optional) – _description_. Defaults to True.

  • receive (bool, optional) – _description_. Defaults to True.

  • feedback (bool, optional) – _description_. Defaults to False.

  • connection (str, optional) – _description_. Defaults to “11111”.

Returns

_description_

Return type
